Waste transported by land

WASTE LITHIUM ION CELLS & BATTERIES – Fully regulated P903 ADR & IMDG

Applies to:

  • Waste Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 20 Wh/cell
  • Waste Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 100Wh/battery

Note: waste cells and batteries transported as new one.

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm; except in the case of packages od such dimensions that they can only bear smaller labels.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation.

  • Each battery incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each battery is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Each battery containing cells or series of cells connected in parallel must be equipped with an effective means, as necessary, to prevent dangerous reverse current flow (e.g. diodes, fuses).
  • Batteries manufactured after 31 December 2011 must be marked with the Wh rating on the outside case.

Transport mode: ADR

Packing instructions: P903

  • Cells must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging which could cause a short circuit.
  • Cells must be packed so that they are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the cells within the packaging.
  • Use only approved packaging conforming to PG II performance level.

Packagings:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H1, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Batteries ≥ 12 h (gross) with a strong impact resistant outer casing:

  • Not required UN approved packagings for batteries, or assemblies of such batteries, when packed in strong outer packagings or protective enclosures (i.g. fully enclosed or wooden slatted crates)
  • Allowed transport on Pallets or otter handling devices
  • Batteries must be secured to prevent inadvertent movement, and the terminals must not support the weight of other superimposed elements

Weight limit: No limit

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: Chapter 1.1.3.6 limit ≤ 333 kg Net

Marking: UN3480

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing waste lithium ion cells and batteries, fully regulated, according Packing Isntrcution P903 (ADR & IMDG).

WASTE LITHIUM ION CELLS & BATTERIES – Fully regulated P903a ADR only

Applies to:

  • Waste Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 20 Wh/cell
  • Waste Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 100Wh/battery

Note: applicable only for road transportation ADR

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm; except in the case of packages od such dimensions that they can only bear smaller labels.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation.

  • Each battery incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each battery is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Each battery containing cells or series of cells connected in parallel must be equipped with an effective means, as necessary, to prevent dangerous reverse current flow (e.g. diodes, fuses).
  • Batteries manufactured after 31 December 2011 must be marked with the Wh rating on the outside case.

Transport mode: ADR

Packing instructions: P903a

  • Cells must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging which could cause a short circuit.
  • Cells must be packed so that they are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the cells within the packaging.

Approved packagings: Only use approved packagings conforming to Packaging Group II performance level, for example:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H1, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Weight limit: No limit

Non approved packagings: Can be used, provided that:

  • They meet the general provisions of 4.1.1, except 4.1.1.3 and 4.1.3
  • Batteries shall be protected against short circuit
  • The cells and batteries are packed ad stowed so as to prevent any risk of short circuit.

Weight limit: ≤ 30 kg Gross

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: Chapter 1.1.3.6 limit ≤ 333 kg Net

Marking: UN3480

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing waste lithium ion cells and batteries, fully regulated, according Packing Isntrcution P903a (ADR only).

MIX WASTE LITHIUM ION CELLS & BATTERIES (with other non-lithium cells and batteries or alone) – P903b + SP 636_ADR only

No ADR: Transport of mix batteries are not subjected to the other provisions of ADR if they meet both P903b and SP 636, otherwise they are fully regulated under P903b.

Applies to:

  • Used lithium cells and batteries with a gross mass of not more than 500 g each
  • Mix of Lithium Cells and batteries, unsorted, collected with other non-lithium cells and batteries carriage for disposal between the consumer collecting points and the intermediate processing facility

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard label: Not required, only inscription “USED LITHIUM CELLS”

Prerequisite: Used Lithium cells and batteries with a gross mass of not more than 500 g each

Transport mode: ADR

Special Provisions: 636b

Used lithium cells and batteries wich a gross mass of not more than 500 g each collected and presented for carriage for ds^psal between, the consumer collecting point and the intermediate processing facility, together with other non-lithium cells or batteries, are not subjected to the other provisions of the ADR if they meet the following conditions:

  • The provisions of packing instructions P903b are complied with
  • A quality assurance system is in place to ensure that the total amount of lithium cells or batteries per transport unit does not exceed 333 kg
  • Packages shall bear the inscription: “USED LITHIUM CELLS”.

Packing instructions: P903b

Remark: may be carried together with other used non-lithium batteries or aloes without being individually protected.

Approved packagings: Use only approved packaging conforming to packing group II performance level for solids

  • 1H2: plastic drum with removable head
  • 4H2: plastic solid box
  • 1A2: steel drum with removable head (+polyethylene bag)
  • 4A: steel box (+polyethylene bag)

Polyethylene bag characteristics:

  • Shall have an impact resistance of at least 480 grams in both parallel and perpendicular planes with respect to the length of the bag;
  • Shall have a minimum of 500 microns of thickness with an electrical resistivity of more than 10Mohms and a water absorption rate over 24 hours at 25 °C lower than 0.01%.
  • Shall be closed; and
  • May only be used once;

Weight limit: No limit

Non approved packagings: In collecting trays made from non-conducting material meeting the general conditions of 4.1.1.1, 4.1.1.2 and 4.1.1.8.

Weight limit: ≤ 30 kg (gross)

Additional requirements: The empty space in the packaging shall be fileld with cushioning material. The cushioning material may be dispensed with when the packaging is entirely fitted with a polyethylene bag and the bag is closed.

Hermetically sealed packagings shall be fitter with a venting device according to 4.1.1.8. The venting device shall be so designed that an overpressure caused by gases does not exceed 10 kPa.

Transport according: SP 636 + P903b

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Not required

Tunnel code: -

Transport cat.: -

Exemptions: -
